resources.string: Available only in the Donate version
Enable or disable whole Sanity system. If disabled, this application won\'t affect phone calls.
Quick start of Sanity during calls and SMS (the application process will always stay in memory as background service).
Show each new incoming SMS asking you to reply.
Each time you activate the Silent mode, Sanity will ask you to choose a timeout for restoring automatically the Normal mode.
Each time you activate the Ariplane mode, Sanity will ask you to choose a timeout for restoring automatically the Normal mode.
Force bluetooth audio device to be correctly handled by Sanity.
Check this option only if Sanity enable/disable handsfree or devices in a wrong way when the phone is far/close to your ear.
Tap here to backup/restore all current preferences to/from memory card.
Set default values for all application preferences.
Delete all call filters currently configured.
Set a global password for changing the options and for accessing to the resources of Sanity.
Always show passwords using readable text.
Manage settings profiles to quickly change more preferences in one fell swoop.
Which devices should be enabled or disabled to reduce electromagnetic waves during a call.
Disable GPS during a call (it will be restored at call end). It works with many phone models, but not with all.
Disable Mobile Data (2G/3G) during a call (it will be restored at call end). It works with many phone models, but not with all.
Skip automatic Mobile Data (2G/3G) disabling during a call when GPS is enabled.
Disable Wifi during a call (it will be restored at call end).
Disable Bluetooth during a call (it will be restored at call end).
Skip automatic Bluetooth disabling during a call if there are Bluetooth devices connected to phone.
Skip automatic Mobile Data (2G/3G) and Wifi disabling during a call if phone is configured like Router Wifi.
Skip automatic Mobile Data disabling during a call if Tethering USB is enabled.
Turn on Bluetooth when call starts. This can be helpful for automatic Bluetooth headsets connection.
Timeout for turning off Bluetooth if no headsets were connected.
In all cases Bluetooth will be turned off when call ends.
Options for enabling and disabling devices during a call by checking proximity sensor.
Turn OFF devices only when the phone is close to your ear. (If disabled, turn off when call start.)
Delay time for turning OFF devices when your ear is close to phone.
Turn ON devices (turned off by Sanity) during a call when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Delay time for turning ON devices when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Force to turn OFF the screen during call when the phone is close to your ear.
Force to turn ON the screen during call when the phone is far from your ear.
Automatically enable/disable handsfree when the phone is far/close to your ear.
Delay time for automatically turning ON handsfree when the phone is NOT close to your ear.
Volume to set when the handsfree is automatically enabled.
Enable handsfree when the call begins.
Delay time for automatically turning ON the handsfree when call begins.
Turn off handsfree on call end, just before the call end sound is played.
How many times up to automatically enable the handsfree during one call when the phone is far from ear.
How many times up to automatically disable the handsfree during one call when the phone is close to ear.
Options for recording call audio on memory card.
This free version is limited to 2 minutes for each recording.
Attention please: in some countries call recording is forbidden by government laws. The author disagrees every illegal use of Sanity. Be aware, use it at your risk!
Put recording notification on statusbar during phone call: tap that notification to start/stop call recording.
Select the source device used for recording audio. Attention: many phones are limited to "Microphone" as only working one!
Select file format used to save audio file recordings.
Show list of audio files recorded by Sanity (stored in \"Sanity\" folder inside memory card).
Allow system multimedia scanner to track audio files recorded by Sanity.
Choose to start or stop recording using camera button during phone call.
Android recording system is very limited: actually you can record calls only when HANDSFREE IS TURNED ON!
Enable automatic START recording. If disabled, Sanity won\'t start recording automatically.
Delay time for starting audio recording automatically.
Automatic start audio recording when handsfree is turned on by Sanity.
Headset rules about automatic start audio recording.
Choose call directions for starting audio recording.
Maximum times to start automatic recording during a single call.
Enable automatic STOP recording. If disabled, you\'ll have to stop manually.
Delay for stopping audio recording automatically.
Automatic stop audio recording when handsfree is turned off by Sanity.
Headset rules about automatic stop audio recording.
Choose the maximum duration of one audio recording. Sanity will stop the recording after this time.
Automatically remove the old recordings. Choose how long to keep the recordings.
Block incoming calls and SMS filtering out the phone number of the caller.
Enable call blocking system to refuse incoming calls.
Tap here to show the description of all call block methods.
Choose how to block incoming calls.
Choose when to restore the signal after the call has been blocked.
Pick up (answer) the incoming calls just before block. It may be useful to prevent diversions to voicemail.
Don\'t block incoming calls when the phone is in silent mode.
Notify the last blocked call on the status bar.
Show the detailed list of all blocked calls.
Enable SMS blocking system to automatically delete unwanted messages.
If activated, use the filter of the call blocker to block the SMS also. Otherwise you can choose a specific filter to block SMS.
Notify the last blocked SMS on the status bar.
Choose how many blocked SMS should be kept in the history.
Show the detailed list of recent blocked SMS messages.
Speak the name of the caller when receiving a call or a SMS.
Speak the caller\'s name when a call is received (while the phone rings).
Tap here to open the Android global settings about the \"text to speech\" engine.
Enable announce only if the headsets are connected.
Don\'t announce the caller when the phone is in silent mode.
Mute the ringtone when announcing the caller\'s name.
Choose the volume level used to announce calls.
Choose the voice tone for announcing the caller\'s name.
How many times the caller\'s name will be spoken when ringing.
How long to wait before announcing again the caller\'s name.
Choose what to speak BEFORE the caller\'s name.
Choose what to speak AFTER the caller\'s name.
Type the word \"Anonymous\" in your language to announce anonymous calls.
Type the word \"Unknown\" in your language to announce caller is not in contacts.
Use an alternate audio stream for announcing. Enable this option only if you cannot hear the announcement (try it hereunder).
Tap here to try announcing using current options.
Speak the name of the sender when receiving a SMS (only the sender\'s name is announced, NOT the message content).
Choose the volume level used to announce SMS.
Choose what to speak BEFORE the sender\'s name.
Choose what to speak AFTER the sender\'s name.
If activated, use the filter of the call announcer. Otherwise you can choose a specific filter to announce SMS.
Choose what phone numbers your phone will ring or vibrate also when it\'s in silent mode.
If disabled, your phone will never ring when it\'s in silent mode. If enabled, you can choose which calls will always ring or vibrate.
Don\'t enable urgent calls if the phone is set to vibrate in silent mode.
Choose if ring or vibrate on urgent incoming calls.
Rules to answer automatically on incoming calls.
Enable automatic answering on incoming calls.
Enable automatic answering only if the headsets are connected.
Don\'t answer automatically when the phone is in silent mode.
Use an alternative way to answer. Check it only if the automatic answer doesn\'t work on your phone.
Rules to dial anonymous call (automatically hide your caller ID).
Choose to enable or disable automatic anonymous outgoing calls completely.
If enabled, Sanity will ask you to confirm if the outgoing call should be anonymous.
Notify when the outgoing call is anonymous (in all cases you won\'t be notified when not anonymous).
Choose your country to set the dialing prefix used for hiding your caller ID.
The custom prefix used for hiding your caller ID. If you don\'t know it, choose your country.
Options for automatic volume setting during a call.
Volume to automatically set during a call while no headsets are used.
Volume to automatically set during a call while using wired headsets.
Volume to automatically set during a call while using wireless headsets.
Play only the audio of the conversation, muting any other audio stream during phone calls.
Choose which the special events which vibrate the phone.
Vibrate when an outgoing call begins.
Vibrate when a phone call ends.
Choose how to vibrate the phone.
Tap here to test the vibration mode.
Choose when Sanity should show notifications.
Notify when automatic restoration from silent/airplane mode is active.
Notify when devices are automatically turned off by Sanity.
Notify when devices are automatically restored by Sanity.
Notify if Sanity is running when a phone call starts.
Notify when volume is automatically changed by Sanity.
Notify when headsets are connected or disconnected.
Notify when audio recording is stopped by Sanity.
Information about this application and tools for contacting the developer.
Show recent changes about last Sanity versions.
Tap here to open the official website of the developer\'s forum. You can also use the forum for reporting bugs and for requesting features.
Tap here to show instructions for uninstalling Sanity (useful only on Android Froyo 2.2 or greater).
Tap here to write an email to the developer. Use the FORUM for any question about Sanity!
You are invited to leave a comment about Sanity on Market. Tap here to open Market. Please don\'t report bugs in Market comments.
Tap here to open the official web site of the GNU General Public License version 3.
In addition to Market, you can donate using PayPal. Once you complete the donation, the author will send you the donation version. Tap here to open the PayPal site.
Choose the phone numbers for applying the action.
Choose to include or exclude the phone numbers in the following list.
All non-anonymous unknown phone numbers (don\'t stored in contacts).
List of phone numbers don\'t stored in contacts.
Choose the phone contacts in this list.
All contacts you tagged as favourites.
Choose the groups of contacts in this list.
Choose the phone number prefixes in this list.
Choose when this filter should be enabled.
If disabled, the filter will be always enabled.
Tap here to create a new time range. If you don\'t create time ranges, the filter will be enabled for the entire day.
Tap here for fast searching of a contact.
Sanity is free. If you like this application, support the development with a donation.
You have supported Sanity. Thank you for your donation!
This is the full version of Sanity.
Use administrator privileges for turning off screen when you put the phone close to your ear during a call.
Preferences backup file exists in memory card. Would you like to restore all preferences now?
If you activate the profile, you\'ll lose all current preferences.To avoid this, add a new profile before activating.\nAre you sure to activate the profile?
The current preferences are already saved in the active profile.\n\nWould you really create a new profile?
Would you SAVE all current preferences to the profile \"%s\"? All profile preferences will be overwritten.
Would you really DELETE the profile \"%s\"?
Are you sure to DELETE the selected item?
Are you sure to DELETE all %s selected items?
Are you sure to CANCEL all changes?
Are you sure to REMOVE all history entries?
How many hours and minutes to remain silent
How many hours and minutes to remain offline
Tap here to START call recording
Tap here to STOP call recording
Sanity: 2 minutes limit reached, recording is stopped.
There are no audio files of call records. Start a call record to see its audio file here.
Sanity: action canceled, the recording system is not running.
Choose what to do with this audio file.
This option requires at least Android version 2.2 (Froyo). Sorry, your phone has Android 2.1 (Eclair).
Choose to backup or restore all current preferences to memory card.
No backup file exists on memory card! You have to make a backup before trying to restore.
No profile exists. Use menu to create new one.
Choose the name of the new profile to create
Change the name of the profile
There aren\'t entries in this list. Use menu to create new ones.
Sorry, this option is available only in the Donate version.
The contact \"%s\" has NOT a phone number!
The call log doesn\'t contain new unknown numbers!
Sorry, this feature doen\'t work on your Android version.
Sanity error: unable to create directory on sdcard for saving audio recording!
Sanity error: unable to start audio recording!
Error while changing scanner properties: permission denied on file \"%s\"
Unable to open Market! Check Market application is rightly installed.
Sanity error: unable to initialize TTS engine!
Sanity error: unable to block call using the current method!
Sanity error: unable to answer the call (maybe your phone is incompatible)!
You must choose at least one day to enable date and time filtering!
Canceled: the start time must be earlier than the stop time!
Canceled: the old password is wrong!
Canceled: the new password is not equal to the confirmed one!
